The New York state Supreme Court has reinstated all employees who were fired for not being vaccinated, ordering back pay and saying their rights had been violated.

The court found Monday that "being vaccinated does not prevent an individual from contracting or transmitting COVID-19." New York City Mayor Eric Adams claimed earlier this year that his administration would not rehire employees who had been fired over their vaccination status.

NYC alone fired roughly 1,400 employees for being unvaccinated earlier this year after the city adopted a vaccine mandate under former Mayor Bill de Blasio.

(Plus d'explications en fin de publication via le drop 1279)

Q possède également les serveurs: les e-mails illégaux d'Hillary et les tentatives de destruction de preuves ont échoué. Q a tout.
Échec et mat.

La prise de contrôle de TWITTER juste avant les Midterms n'est pas une coïncidence. Les WH saisissent l'un des principaux organes de propagande [DS] ET ONT UN ACCÈS TOTAL AUX DONNÉES (ils avaient déjà tout ça depuis longtemps et rien n'a pu être supprimé définitivement).
TOUT ÇA EST BEAUCOUP PLUS VASTE QUE VOUS NE POUVEZ L'IMAGINER. 
TOUT ÇA MÈNE AUX TRIBUNAUX MILITAIRES, CRIMES DE TRAHISON, SÉDITION, ESPIONNAGE. MISE EN DANGER DE L'ESPÈCE HUMAINE, CRIMES CONTRE L'HUMANITÉ,...
[Ils ont toutes les traces de merde et cela va atteindre le ventilateur de l'état profond]

Vous avez une voix.
Être entendu.
La patience n'est pas toujours facile.

[...]*¹

Il est également intéressant de noter qu'Elon Musk a publié un Meme de Mario (le plus célèbre des plombier) le 09 octobre 2022.
"Quand appelez-vous un PLOMBIER ?"
Quand vous avez une FUITE.
] EXPOSITION [ DES FUITES DES COMMUNICATIONS.

BONUS Gématrie de [auth478-24zgP=2876]

[...]*¹

Codes.

De nouvelles informations révélées aujourd'hui.
Communications Gmail.
[R] (Rothschilds).
[PAR EXEMPLE].
Définissez Evergreen. (Hillary Clinton)"

Le Delta du drop du 22 octobre est parfaitement dans le thème: "Ce n'est que le début, Padawan. Ils ne peuvent plus se cacher dans l'ombre [la grande technologie, les grands médias, le parti [D] étant exposé aux yeux de tous]." Q
Il est intéressant de noter le silence des communications Q du 23 au 27 octobre.
SILENCE DES COMMUNICATIONS=OPÉRATIONS EN COURS.
Opération de prise de contrôle de TWITTER le 27 et vendredi 28 octobre, avec la signature.
Retour des communications Q le 28 octobre avec le drop 0, 1 et 2 de Q sur l'arrestation d'Hillary Clinton.
Hillary Clinton ne sera pas arrêtée PUBLIQUEMENT demain (cela est plus que probablement déjà fait (dans le secret militaire connu des initiés)) Mais le film doit continuer jusqu'au précipice. Q NOUS DONNE JUSTE ENCORE DES MIETTES POUR QUE LES ANONS PUISSENT SAVOIR QUE LE PLAN SE DÉROULE COMME IL DOIT SE DÉROULER.

"Ça devait être comme ça."
"Il fallait faire comme ça."

_source.message:
Journalism in Crisis: The War on Dissent - Whitney Delivers Speech to the First Annual Children’s Health Defense Conference, October, 2022

An excerpt of the transcript and voiceover is featured below:

There are major efforts, years in the making, to censor dissenting opinions under the guise of censoring “misinformation.” As many readers are undoubtedly aware, what was last year’s “misinformation” with respect to COVID-19 injections has only recently undergone a dramatic change into “breaking news.” Yet, many of us who were right all along and were censored when factual information that is now recognized as true was erroneously labeled “misinformation,” have received no apologies or compensation from our lost income. In many cases, our old platforms have not been returned to us. The censorship hammer has not been wielded with incompetence, instead it has been and is being intentionally used to squeeze out those of us who would dare to speak the truth, no matter how inconvenient it may be at the time.

The argument that is often deployed to dismiss concerns regarding online censorship is the claim that the dominant social media companies are private, not public, entities. However, in reality, the Big Tech firms that dominate our online lives, particularly Google and Facebook, were either created with some involvement of the U.S. national security state or have become major U.S. government and/or military contractors over the past two decades. When it comes to censoring and deplatforming individuals for claims that run counter to U.S. government narratives, it should be clear that Google-owned YouTube, and other tech platforms owned by contractors to the U.S. military and intelligence communities, have a major conflict of interest in their stifling of speech.

The line between “private” Silicon Valley and the public sector has become increasingly blurred, and it is now a matter of record that these companies have illegally passed information onto intelligence services such as the NSA, for use in what are blatantly unconstitutional surveillance programs aimed at American civilians. All indications point to the military-industrial complex having now expanded into the military-technology-industrial complex.

These days, one need only look at important government commissions — such as the National Security Commission on Artificial Intelligence, which was headed by former Google/Alphabet CEO Eric Schmidt — to see how this de facto public-private partnership between Silicon Valley and the national security state functions, and its outsized role in setting important tech-related policies for both the private and public sectors. For example, that commission, largely comprised of representatives of the military, intelligence community and Big Tech, has helped set policy on “countering disinformation” online.

 More specifically, it has recommended weaponizing Artificial Intelligence (AI) for the express purpose of identifying online accounts to deplatform and speech to censor, framing this recommendation as essential to U.S. national security as it relates to “information warfare.”

There are already several companies competing to market an AI-powered censorship engine to the national security state as well as the private sector, for use against journalists and non-journalists alike. One of these companies is Primer AI, a “machine intelligence” company that “builds software machines that read and write in English, Russian, and Chinese to automatically unearth trends and patterns across large volumes of data.” The company publicly states that their work “supports the mission of the intelligence community and broader DOD by automating reading and research tasks to enhance the speed and quality of decision-making.” Their current roster of clients includes not just the U.S. military and the U.S. intelligence community, but major American companies like Walmart and private “philanthropic” organizations like the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation.

Source: Dr. Robert Malone Substack
